result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas L McClelland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA surcharge is waived.  In lieu of payment of court costs, defendant to serve 5 days jail, concurrent.  Apply 5 days sentence credit.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 68 days sentence credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas L McClelland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Douglas L McClelland in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Kelsey Morin.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.


Court orders the following:
100 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
68 Days Credit.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid -FORTHWITH - In Lieu of Payment - 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - 5 Days Credit - Concurrent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification.
Signed by Judge Neal Nettesheim on 02/16/15.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Douglas L McClelland in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Kelsey Morin.   

Atty. Morin requests bail modification to a signature bond and arguments were presented.
State objection and presented arguments.

Court Denies - Request for Bail Modification.
Bail and conditions remain as previously fixed.
Court signed order.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.


  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/St. Mathias Church in Waukesha listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Douglas L McClelland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge Fragoso for atorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Bail can be readdressed at next hearing.  Defendant allowed a non collect phone call.  
  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
